Subject: Problems with Seeds and Credentials
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=196959921
X-Yahoo-Profile: l33tminion

We just updated to the most recent version of Heritrix from CVS on our
project, and we were confused to find that our list of seed URIs now
seems to be interpreted as a list of files from which to get seeds.

The description for seeds (on new.jsp) still says:
"Fill in seed URIs below, one per line. Comment lines begin with '#'."

When I view the settings after setting some seeds, however, it says,
"Seed list too large to edit" under seeds, with the words "seed list"
linking to what I put in the seeds box.  This happens even if we only
list one seed.  What is going on?

---

Also, we're trying to retrieve files from a secure server (using the
Rfc2617 credentials).  When the credentials are wrong, we get a 401
error as expected.  However, when the credentials are correct, it
hangs while trying to retrieve robots.txt (which is not on the
server).  On a non-secure server, things worked fine (it would get a
404 error while trying to retrieve robots.txt, then move on to
retrieving the desired files).

Here's the stack trace:
java.io.IOException: mark/reset not supported
    at java.io.InputStream.reset(InputStream.java:331)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.isResponseAvailable(HttpConnection.java:876)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$HttpConnectionAdapter.isResponseAvailable(MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager.java:1303)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.readResponseBody(HttpMethodBase.java:1695)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.readResponseBody(HttpMethodBase.java:1638)
    at org.archive.httpclient.HttpRecorderGetMethod.readResponseBody(HttpRecorderGetMethod.java:98)
    at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP$2.readResponseBody(FetchHTTP.java:294)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.readResponse(HttpMethodBase.java:1601)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.execute(HttpMethodBase.java:999)
    at org.archive.httpclient.HttpRecorderGetMethod.execute(HttpRecorderGetMethod.java:116)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:382)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:168)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:393)
    at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:324)
    at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.innerProcess(FetchHTTP.java:307)
    at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:102)
    at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:273)
    at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:143)

Thanks,
-Samuel Freilich
